Nocturnal Animals is directed by Tom Ford well known for directing A Single Man and stars Amy Adams and Jake Gyllenhaal This film can be divided into two chapters : The Real World and The Novel A woman whose idyllic life is getting destroyed by her calismatic second husband always travelling around gets a novel written by her ex husband played by Jake Gyllenhaal and which leads to The Novel that follows a man played by Jake Gyllenhaal tries to capture three hooligans who took his wife and daughter away on their way and raped and ended up murdering them with a help from the police Â  Â  The plot is really intertwined with t he present past and the story in the novel that pretty much darkened and made it creepy Â . Michael Shannon received a nomination for Best Suppritng Actor at The Academy Awards I was able to enjoy it very freshly since I knew nothing about this movie In short it really did blow me away and kinda regret ted watch ing it now sho ul d'v e seen it like when it came out in the United States Although It seems very much like a thriller and kinda horror film this is the very mystery one that I was looking for The weird thing should I call it Dir ec to r's trick ?, is that Jake Gyllenhaal plays two roles and the perspective of Amy constantly changes scene to scene that must have confused me a lot though I highly recommend it to everyone I loved it Â . Thank you for reading my brief review of Nocturnal Animals ", coming out in November in Japan !!.

I must say I love Nocturnal Animal .". I also liked Arrival I enjoyed these films not only because they both feature one of the great est actresses of our time and yes I do think she deserves an Oscar ), but because both of these films had meticulously designed worlds for the sole purpose of storytelling Everything in these films was there to pull us into the beautifully crafted layered and sophisticated stories. These movies allow me to both think and feel at the same time. Every time I think I caught and solved the little puzzle they put there for me it satisfies my silly ego that wants to believe that I m intelligent. The story within a story structure of this film is very effective ; the stories are wound together to feed and fuel each other The unfiltered emotion of Edward fed right into us through the man uscript and Susan s through her reaction to it The structure forces us to think about the duality and we start to speculate who in the book corresponds to who in reality. At first we think so Edward is Edward and Susan is Susan .." but as we know from later in the story the relationship between the two world is not as simple as it seems but Tom helps us by dropping obvious hints in brilliant ways He cast Isla Fisher for the Book Susan rather than Amy Adams and we quickly realize Book Susan is not representing Susan in reality ," and it enable us to think more about other characters in the book ; Who s this frightening Aaron Taylor Johnson supposed to be ?" And so on I had to keep thinking and at the same time cope with t he not so subtle emotional elements in the story. .. so I was glad the pace of the film was not too fast. The film is of course quite beautifully shot the look and feel related to each character are consistent I mean Tom Ford is Tom Ford an aesthetic perfectionist Awesome.

Susan Morrow who is a wealthy art gallery owner got a parcel that was a novel named Nocturnal Animals from her ex husband. She didn t know that she ll be haunted by the novel. The story comes and goes to present and a story of the novel. It feels like the story of the novel happened for real. From the novel you ll get what Tony who is her ex wanna say. Recently both of Amy and Jake play characters with feeling of emptiness makes me depressed which means they fit and well played. I didn t like the last part of the movie that made me confused. I just couldn t understand the point what its wanna tell us. The movie drove me like my feelings went up up and ?.. Expe ct that part I go t into it.

Nocturnal Animals was the most terrifying movie I've seen since Whiplash Not in a horror way but because of the c haracters in it. Aaron Taylor Johnson here and JK Simmons in Whiplash are people that truly terrify me.. The acting is fantastic all around This movie is told from the perspective of Amy Adams She reads a manu script from her novelist ex husband played by Jake Gyllenhaal The story in the man uscript is riveting. The casting of Isla Fisher who plays a version of Amy Adams in the story was very unique They are both red headed and look alike in real life so that casting choice was brilliant. Aaron Taylor Johnson ........ My god he scared me. The first scene he appears in and the entire scenario that surrounds him is an absolute nightmare for any father. His performance was truly amazing He transformed himself into this character He s probably one of the worst of humanity but through his performance he brings out a weird charm in his character. The metaphorical part of the story really confused me. Some aspects of its conclusion had me scratching my head Made me feel really stupid ..... I wanted to really love this but it s unsettling storyline made me not able to do that. Not saying that s bad because this is an excellently directed movie and a good noir like thriller.
I saw this and I was really excited to see this because I love Jake Gyllenhaal but I ended up hating this movie I really wanted to like it but it was so boring and I couldn t st and it.

Nocturnal Animals unconventional storytelling -- which may put off certain audiences -- elevates what seemingly a simple psychological noir premise Its devilish nature accompanied by stellar assemble casts -- the fiction al ones particularly Gyllenhaal Shannon and Taylor Johnson )-- will slowly crawl on you and take you on an emotional roller coaster ; Leaving you exhausted but strangely satisfied out of the entire experience.

The bitter aftertaste Star Wars left me with is almost gone Nocturnal Animals is visually spectacular which is to be expected from a fashion designer like Tom Ford. But it wasn t just appearance there was a lot of substance too A very engaging and complex storytelling with some strong performances especially by Amy Adams.
